trainings.title: ARES Ensea CSS Training
trainings.description2:
Continuing from the first training session on HTML for ARES at ENSEA, this 2-hour online session
                    took place on Thursday, December 19, at 4 PM. The focus was on the fundamentals of CSS, including an
                    introduction to selectors, methods to manipulate them, and the process of integrating CSS with HTML
                    to create visually appealing web pages. The session provided a strong foundation for participants to
                    enhance their web development skills.

trainings.title: ARES HTML Training
trainings.description2:
The ARES Web Development Training Series kicked off on Saturday, December 14, 2024, at 10:00 AM at
                    ENSEA. This 4-hour session served as a comprehensive introduction to web development, exploring the
                    fundamental concepts of the development process. Participants also dove into the basics of HTML,
                    gaining hands-on experience by creating static web pages to build a solid foundation for their web
                    development journey.

trainings.title: ARES Git and GitHub Training
trainings.description2:
The first session of the Git and GitHub workshop took place on Friday, November 15, 2024, at ENSEA.
                    This event, organized collaboratively by ARES (the robotics club) and ATHEN ENSEA, introduced
                    participants to the foundational concepts of Git and GitHub. The session guided attendees on using
                    the Git application and demonstrated how to publish modifications effectively on the GitHub
                    platform, providing essential skills for version control and collaboration.

trainings.title: Google FSB Git Training
trainings.description2:
The first session of the Git and GitHub workshop took place on Friday, November 25, 2024, Online.
                    This event, organized collaboratively by Google Club of the faculty of science of Bizerte,
                    introduced
                    participants to the foundational concepts of Git and GitHub. The session guided attendees on using
                    the Git application and demonstrated how to publish modifications effectively on the GitHub
                    platform, providing essential skills for version control and collaboration.

trainings.title: Geeks Git Training
trainings.description2: "description2": "The first session of the Git and GitHub workshop took place on Friday, October 5, 2024, Online. This event introduced participants to foundational concepts of Git and GitHub.

trainings.title: ARES Linux Training
trainings.description2:
ARES, the robotics club preparing for the Cup of France of Robotics, invited me to conduct a
                    workshop on Linux to support their work with the ROS (Robot Operating System) framework. In this
                    session, participants installed VirtualBox and configured Linux on it, ensuring a proper setup for
                    seamless integration with ROS. The workshop provided the foundational tools needed for their
                    robotics projects.

trainings.title: IEEE ISTIC Git Training
trainings.description2:
The first session of the Git and GitHub workshop took place on Friday, July 18, 2024, Online.
                    This event, organized collaboratively by IEEE ISTIC BOREJ CEDRIA student branch, introduced
                    participants to the foundational concepts of Git and GitHub. The session guided attendees on using
                    the Git application and demonstrated how to publish modifications effectively on the GitHub
                    platform, providing essential skills for version control and collaboration.

trainings.title: Talend Training
trainings.description2:
In an unplanned workshop session for my 2nd-year Software Engineering classmates at the Higher
                    National Engineering School of Tunis, I shared insights on completing an ETL task using Talend.
                    Invited by the teacher during our Business Intelligence course, I demonstrated the steps I followed
                    in my project, guiding my peers through the process and offering practical tips based on my
                    experience.

trainings.title: IEEE CS FSB Streamlit Training
trainings.description2:
On Saturday, March 4, 2023, I conducted an online Streamlit training session for the IEEE Faculty of
                    Science of Bizerte Student Branch. During the session, I guided participants through configuring
                    Python to install the Streamlit framework. We covered the basics of Streamlit, built a data science
                    application together, and explored the process of hosting it, providing attendees with hands-on
                    experience and practical skills in web app development.

trainings.title: IEEE ENSIT WIE Training
trainings.description2:
As part of a journey organized by the WIE Affinity Group of IEEE ENSIT for primary school students,
                    I had the opportunity to introduce kids to the basics of algorithms through the Scratch application.
                    The session was filled with fun and laughter as I explained programming concepts in an engaging and
                    interactive way, sparking curiosity and excitement among the young learners.

trainings.title: IEEE ENSIT Git Training
trainings.description2:
The first session of the Git and GitHub workshop took place on Friday, January 17, 2024, in ENSIT.
                    This event, organized collaboratively by IEEE ENSIT Student Branch of the Higher national
                    Engineering School of Tunis, introduced
                    participants to the foundational concepts of Git and GitHub. The session guided attendees on using
                    the Git application and demonstrated how to publish modifications effectively on the GitHub
                    platform, providing essential skills for version control and collaboration.

trainings.title: Geeks Machine Learning Training
trainings.description2:
I conducted machine learning training sessions for the ENSIT Geeks Club at ENSIT, where we explored
                    the significance of machine learning and its progression from AI to deep learning. The sessions
                    covered supervised machine learning, delving into classification and regression, and unsupervised
                    machine learning through clustering. To conclude, I demonstrated how to deploy machine learning
                    models using Streamlit, offering participants practical and actionable skills.

trainings.title: IEEE ENSIT ML Training
trainings.description2:
I conducted machine learning training sessions for the IEEE ENSIT Student Branch at ENSIT preparing
                    to the TSYP10 Contest, where we
                    explored
                    the significance of machine learning and its progression from AI to deep learning. The sessions
                    covered supervised machine learning, delving into classification and regression, and unsupervised
                    machine learning through clustering. To conclude, I demonstrated how to deploy machine learning
                    models using Streamlit, offering participants practical and actionable skills.

trainings.title: Geeks Hack Workshop
trainings.description2:
In preparation for ENSIT Geeks Hack 2.0, I was invited to share my problem-solving skills with
                    colleagues. During the session, I tackled various IT problems, explained the algorithms used to
                    solve them, and discussed the optimal programming languages for each scenario. This interactive
                    session aimed to equip participants with practical approaches to problem-solving.

trainings.title: GLSI Class Training
trainings.description2:
During my university years at the Faculty of Science of Bizerte, I led various training sessions and
                    workshops with my classmates. Some were supervised by our professors, while others were organized
                    voluntarily. The sessions covered a diverse range of topics, including JakartaEE, SOA, JavaFX,
                    Database Management, and Operating Systems, helping to deepen our understanding of these key areas
                    in computer science.

trainings.title: AOC Python Training
trainings.description2:
My first planned training session at the university was a milestone I will never forget. With over
                    50 attendees, including professors, I had the opportunity to lead a 2-hour Python training session.
                    While the content was focused on the basics, including Object-Oriented Programming, it was a perfect
                    moment that marked an important step in my journey. The session wasnâ€™t deep, but it was an
                    unforgettable experience that set the stage for future endeavors in training and public speaking.
